General
Duration Set the duration in milliseconds data is collected to compute the heartbeat. A lower duration would compute the heartbeat faster, but would cause the reading to be less precise. 4000
Period Sets the time period in milliseconds of pace computed by the pacemaker. To change the heartrate output to beats per minute, set this configuration to 60000 milliseconds. 60000
Log Size Sets the size of the pacemaker log, which helps the pacemaker function reliably. A higher value helps the pacemaker more reliably, but causes the pacemaker to take a longer time to process signals. 3
Frequency Set the frequency data is sampled from the circuit. 0.1
Filter Threshold Set the filter threshold, which is the defined as the minimum number of standard deviations the signal is away from the mean. Signals deviation from the mean that are at or above the threshold are registered as a beat. 1.0 Log Size Sets the size of the filter log, which helps the filter function reliably. A higher value helps the filter more reliably, but causes the filter to take a longer time to process signals. 3
Computer Vision Color A number between 0 at 255 that determines the specific color requirement. 0 searches for very dark colors, 255 searches for very bright colors 255 Minimum Area A number that determines the minimum area requirement. Area is defines as the amount of pixels that object occupies. 10.0 Minimum circularity A number that determines the minimum circularity requirement. Circularity measures how close to a circle an object is. 0.8 Minimum Convexity A number that determines the minimum convexity requirement. Convexity is defined as the (Area of the Blob / Area of its convex hull). 0.7 Minimum Inertia A number that determines the minimum inertia requirement. The inertia measures how elongated an object is. 0.7
